instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.ADAPTER_SENSE: What is ADAPTER_SENSE? This is a line between the onewire circuit and the magsafe charger where the magsafe charger can talk to the SMC(system management controller) on the SYS_ONEWIRE line..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, but powers on
threads.message: I have on the bench an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that was originally working but had some corroded components around SMC area so I decided to clean up the areas and now the board turns on but no green/orange magsafe light. the other odd thing is <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.29V. But it is showing a blinking ? folder. I checked <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL>, as well as <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>, all are present. I decided to reball the SMC because of local corrosion. I am reaching out because I am not sure what else to consider.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, but powers on
threads.message:
Did you try qanother DCIN board?
Check continuity from its central pin (Magsafe connector) to <CHIP>U6900</CHIP>.

Post diode mode to ground and voltage at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
If something strange, disconnect BIL and test again.
You may also need to remove <DIODE>D6950</DIODE>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, but powers on
threads.message:
HI, yes I tried 3 known good DCIN's 
We have continuity from pin 3 of DCIN connector and pin 2 of <CHIP>U6900</CHIP>
pin 4/ SCL: .536 (Diode) 3.48V
pin 6/ SDA: .534 (Diode) 3.48V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, but powers on
threads.message:
If it i helpful, this is what I have replaced thus far:
<RESISTOR>R5481</RESISTOR>
<RESISTOR>R5482</RESISTOR>
<TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR>
<CAPACITOR>C3896</CAPACITOR>
<CAPACITOR>C3897</CAPACITOR>
<CAPACITOR>C3898</CAPACITOR>
<CAPACITOR>C3891</CAPACITOR> 
and of course I reballed SMC...

threads.message: Oh wow I didn't realize the fan is also stuck on high.  I put the board in my test chassis to see if it turns on and it does. I looked at HW Monitor and the only thing it reports is HD temp.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, but powers on
threads.message:
Sorry, though you were asking to check continuity from the center pin of Magsafe connector to <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>. Must not understand what your were asking for.

Help me understand what removing <DIODE>D6950</DIODE> does.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, but powers on
threads.message:
Pin 2 of <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> is ground!!!
Do you really think I asked to check ground continuity?

<DIODE>D6950</DIODE> should be good in your case; SCL/SDA lines look good...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, but powers on
threads.message: No, you said "center pin", wasn't sure what that meant. Still don't.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, but powers on
threads.message:
Man, do you have continuity from central pin of Magsafe to pin 5 of <CHIP>U6900</CHIP>???
There could be a low value resistor in serie, nothing more (on DCIN board).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, but powers on
threads.message: There is indeed continuity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, but powers on
threads.message:
Is time to change SMC now.
Once removed, check continuity for <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> between <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> and SMC pad.
If no good, repair the trace and reball original SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, but powers on
threads.message: Replaced SMC, got magsafe light and was working great, until I ultrasonic'd it. Now it is not posting...1

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, but powers on
threads.message:
Why do you like so much the ultrasound?
Maybe broken trace, because of hot spot, if you didn't use seep option.
Also could be knocked off component.
Which signals missing now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, but powers on
threads.message: Make sure it's completely dry and there are no random residue on the board. Often you just let it rest for a day or two and it comes back to life.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, but powers on
threads.message: Thanks piernov, will try that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, but powers on
threads.message: I used weep function on UC, only cleaned fpr 2 min.  I'll check for broken traces. I UC'd cause I couldn't get all of the flux fout from under the SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, but powers on
threads.message: I used sweep function on UC, only cleaned for 2 min.  I'll check for broken traces. I UC'd cause I couldn't get all of the flux out from under the SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, but powers on
threads.message:
You should use small flux amount to resolder SMC.
And no need to clean it, if is good quality; do NOT use chinese honey!!!
